messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Hi in CT
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Judy, I LOVE YOU! You are so right - every day is a school day and I have been teaching him since he was in the womb. Waffles it is! Thanks! Fiona
messages.messageBody:
Hey Judy, I LOVE YOU! You are so right - every day is a school day and I have
been teaching him since he was in the womb. Waffles it is! Thanks!

messages.subject: Fun days
messages.msgSnippet: Or how about,,, Just another Manic Monday, wish it was Sunday, cause that s my fun day  Now everyday can be a fun day!! OK so this is dating me, I remember
messages.messageBody:
Or how about,,,"Just another Manic Monday, wish it was Sunday, cause that's my fun day" Now everyday can be a fun day!!
OK so this is dating me, I remember driving to high school listening to the Bangles.
Kelli T
Betsy wrote:**Sorry, Sandra. Tomorrow is my son, Andrew's, last day of elementary
school,
or jail as we call it. ; ) Just kidding. I'm letting school go til
Monday,
when we will begin our first day of homeschooling. We're all very excited!**

Hi, Fiona --

I think the point Sandra was hinting at is that for most unschooling
families, everyday is like Saturday. We never have a Monday that is
like a school day.

Betsy

PS (Who recorded that song with the chorus "Tell me why? I don't like Mondays!")

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Hi in CT
messages.msgSnippet: **Sorry, Sandra. Tomorrow is my son, Andrew s, last day of elementary school, or jail as we call it. ; ) Just kidding. I m letting school go til Monday, when
messages.messageBody:
**Sorry, Sandra. Tomorrow is my son, Andrew's, last day of elementary
school,
or jail as we call it. ; ) Just kidding. I'm letting school go til
Monday,
when we will begin our first day of homeschooling. We're all very excited!**

Hi, Fiona --

I think the point Sandra was hinting at is that for most unschooling
families, everyday is like Saturday. We never have a Monday that is
like a school day.

Betsy

PS (Who recorded that song with the chorus "Tell me why? I don't like Mondays!")

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Hi in CT
messages.msgSnippet: Well... ;-) what we mean is you HAVE started. (years and years ago) He will be learning from whatever he does on Saturday as much as from whatever he does on
messages.messageBody:
Well...
;-)
what we mean is you HAVE started. (years and years ago)
He will be learning from whatever he does on Saturday as much as from
whatever he does on Monday, Hon!
Every day is a 'school' day- NO day is a 'school' day.

You have nothing to 'start' on Monday. In fact, you should just sleep
real late and then go out to breakfast. I think waffles are in order...
In fact, I think TODAY should be his last day and you should go out and
have waffles for dinner now!

Love, Judy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Hi in CT
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry, Sandra. Tomorrow is my son, Andrew s, last day of elementary school, or jail as we call it. ; ) Just kidding. I m letting school go til Monday, when we
messages.messageBody:
Sorry, Sandra. Tomorrow is my son, Andrew's, last day of elementary school,
or jail as we call it. ; ) Just kidding. I'm letting school go til Monday,
when we will begin our first day of homeschooling. We're all very excited!

Fiona


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:

day of school! Monday we'll start. >>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Hi in CT
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you so much. I clicked the link I think Lisa (sorry if that s wrong) sent and it said CT is just suggested. Whew! I sent it anyway, the letters, more out
messages.messageBody:
Thank you so much. I clicked the link I think Lisa (sorry if that's wrong)
sent and it said CT is just suggested. Whew! I sent it anyway, the letters,
more out of courtesy, return receipt requested too. Tomorrows the boy's last
day of school! Monday we'll start.

Thanks, all for your support, in this crazy time for me!
Fiona


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Hi in CT
messages.msgSnippet: As far as I understand the Ct law, you don t HAVE to send in a letter of intent but you can voluntarily do so to comply with the school board. I don t see it
messages.messageBody:
As far as I understand the Ct law, you don't HAVE to send in a letter of
intent but you can voluntarily do so to comply with the school board. I
don't see it as law though. Of course it is for the school board. I
personally only do what the state law requires.

Mary B
